snippet.title: Windows 8 stuns, amazes, and sometimes lets us down (review)
snippet.description: Review: Just like Windows 8 has evolved, so has my opinion of the operating system.

snippet.title: Dear HP: Please Keep Making Those CrunchPads! Er...TouchPads
Acer's Aspire TimelineX 1830T-3721 Is Sleek and Attractive, but Has Iffy Ergonomics
snippet.description: There's a lot to love about the Acer Aspire TimelineX 1830T. At about $700, it's extremely affordable for an ultraportable, offers great workaday performance, has excellent high-def video playback, and runs for over 6 hours on its battery. However, the 1830T also suffers some ergonomic quirks that...

snippet.title: Dell Latitude E4300: A Solid but Unexciting Business Laptop
snippet.description: At first glance, you might mistake the Dell Latitude E4300 for an earlier-vintage laptop: Its sharp lines and subtle finish stick out in today's world of glossy gadgets with rounded corners. That's not to say the E4300 isn't a handsome portable, however--it did grow on me. Even better, the matte...

snippet.title: Toshiba U505-S2980 Gets in Touch With Multitouch
snippet.description: The Toshiba U505-S2980's main gimmick is a multitouch touchscreen. Outside of that, it is, for the most part, a decent laptop, even above average in many ways. But that one gimmick is the root of my issues with this 13-inch notebook--and helps raise its cost to a somewhat pricey $1050 (as of...

snippet.title: HP ProBook 5310m Ultraportable Laptop
snippet.description: HP has a thing of business-savvy beauty on its hands with the ProBook 5310m. Why do I say that? Even the guys in the PC World Labs--who see everything under the sun--were impressed by its industrial design. The sleek black aluminum case, the supple texture on the undercarriage...the list goes on....

snippet.title: Dell Latitude XT2 Tablet PC
snippet.description: Go on, grab the Dell Latitude XT2--it just feels good. The rugged metal-alloy casing gives it a solid, substantial frame. Pick it up, and the 13.3-inch machine is deceptively light (3.8 pounds). Put all of that together, and you seem to have a premium choice for mobility-minded businessfolk in need...

snippet.title: Samsung Go Netbook
snippet.description: As much as I like what Samsung is doing with its new Go netbook (known as the N310 overseas), the company is about this close to surpassing Asus as the king of the shotgun-delivery method, releasing netbooks every 2 minutes. Never mind my cattiness, though. The Go is a stylish and far-from-subdued...

snippet.title: All-in-One PCs With a Touch of Style
snippet.description: We'll say it up front: The iMac is no longer the final word in all-in-one PCs. Though Apple's latest aluminum iMacs were the performance champs in our tests, it's the new wave of competing all-in-ones that are changing the game.

snippet.title: From Apple, a Luxury Laptop in Lean Times
snippet.description: Apple's new MacBook may be the finest-engineered consumer laptop ever built. But that doesn't make it an automatic purchase.
